news.title: Average IRS tax refund is up 10.9% so far this season, early filing data shows
news.summary: The average IRS tax refund is up 10.9% so far this season, according to early filing data. Here's what taxpayers can expect.

news.title: OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger joining OpenAI, Altman says
news.summary: OpenClaw, the open source AI agent that's surged in popularity, will live within OpenAI, according to a post on X from Sam Altman.

news.title: Epstein files fallout: The high-profile people burned by past dealings with a predator
news.summary: Jeffrey Epstein killed himself in a New York City federal jail in 2019. But more than six years later, people are still losing their jobs because of him.

news.title: China's tech shock threatens the U.S. AI monopoly and is 'just getting started'
news.summary: "You could see easily a world where maybe most of the world's population is running on a Chinese tech stack in five to 10 years time," one analyst told CNBC.

news.title: Altman and Pichai among tech CEOs heading to India for major AI summit in a key market
news.summary: India has a huge pool of talent which could be key to continued development of AI. India has a market of young, tech-forward consumers.

news.title: Hegseth reportedly considering severe penalty on Anthropic as negotiations stall
news.summary: Defense Sec. Pete Hegseth reportedly is close to putting Claude maker Anthropic on a “supply chain risk” list that would be a devastating blow to its finances.

news.title: Buying stocks everyone admires is a recipe for underperformance — but Apple breaks the rule
news.summary: Unloved companies with rock-bottom expectations are the real engines of your portfolio. Unloved firms are often undervalued and underappreciated.

news.title: The shale boom that made the U.S. the world’s top oil producer is nearing a crucial turning point
news.summary: The shale-oil revolution that transformed the U.S. into the world’s top oil producer is entering a new phase. It could see America's hard-fought lead in energy erode in fewer than five years.

news.title: These markets have been ‘bangers’ this year. Here’s why they have further to rally, says Goldman Sachs.
news.summary: South Korea and Japan have left Wall Street in the dust in 2026. The two countries are expected to be the world's biggest economies in the next decade.

news.title: The seeds of the dramatic sell-off in AI losers were planted as far back as 2022, says Deutsche Bank
news.summary: Deutsche Bank says angst behind the selloff of over stocks vulnerable to AI disruption has been simmering awhile. Deutsche Bank: The selloff has been going on for some time.
